Summary (from OCLC): Speed Racer finds out that he is the latest in a long line of Racers. He must learn about the many Racers who came before him in order to survive an ages-old threat to his legacy.

15.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
15.title: Forest of Gray City
15.author: Uhm JungHyun ; translation, HyeYoung Im ; English adaptation, J
notes: Vol. 2 published: New York, N.Y. : Yen Press.
"First published in Korea in 2005 by Seoul Cultural Publishers."

"Yun-Ook Jang is a freelance illustrator who rents out a room to help pay off her debts. Her tenant is a drop out named Bum-Moo Lee who only has a part-time job. Before Yun-Ook knew how old Bum-Moo was, he seemed rather mysterious and cold to her, and the two argued all the time. But what? He's only 17? That's just a kid who should be going to school! Then one day, Bum-Moo asks her a most dangerous question: Do you mind if I like you?"

16.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
16.title: Four Letter Worlds
16.author: Eric Stephenson, editor.
notes: An anthology of sixteen comics stories.

17.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
17.title: Goong
17.author: story and art by SoHee Park ; translation, HyeYoung Im ; English adaptation, J
notes: First published: Korea, Seoul Cultural Publishers, 2002.
Summary (from OCLC): Set in an alternate 21st-century reality where Korea possesses a royal family, it follows the lives of the Crown Prince Lee Shin, and his new bride, Chae-kyeong.

18.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
18.title: "I Get a Kick Out Of You"
18.author: J
18.appears_in: Torres & Jason B. p. 26-27 in Expo 2000 (Bethesda, Maryland : The Expo, 2000).

19.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
19.title: Missing You
19.author: story by J
notes: Summary (from SkyRiver): While Darcy is working as a counselor at summer camp, Spinner has trouble facing temptation, and Liberty, apparently suffering from post-partum depression, may be planning a desperate move.

20.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
20.title: Ninja Scroll
20.author: writer, J
20.appears_in: Torres ; artist, Michael Chang Ting Yu.
notes: "Originally published in single magazine form as Ninja Scroll #1-3, 5-7"
Summary (from OCLC): Vagabond samurai Jubei Kibagami is looking for rest. Demons continue to come back from the dead to try to kill him.

21.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
21.title: Raven's Secret
21.author: by J
notes: "Five teenage super heroes, fighting for truth, justice, and the last slice of pizza."

22.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
22.title: Safety Dance
22.author: story by J
notes: "When Marco sees Dylan get into a fight with a homophobic hockey player, he's suddenly super self-conscious about the way the world looks at him. Dylan wants to take their relationship to the next level, but Marco is holding them back. What will it take for Marco to move forward? Ashley is back from merry ol' England but she's finding it hard to reconnect with her stepbrother Toby and to rekindle the romance with ex-boyfriend Jimmy. Is her talk of all things British keeping them at a distance? Or is it her hideous hat?"

23.heading: Torres, J., 1969-
23.title: Sidekicks : the Substitute
23.author: written by J
notes: "Last semester, Shuster Academy, the country's premiere school for super-powered youngsters, welcomed transfer student Terry Highland into its ranks. Being the new kid proved to be a real challenge for her. But just as Terry is learning to fit in, the school is about to welcome another new addition, this time to the faculty."

120.appears_in: Garcia. p. 7 in El Renacimiento, no. 135 (Jan. 9, 1978).
notes: Summary: Aztequito says he stays in the barrio because Huitzilopochtli told him his destiny would be signalled by an eagle with a serpent in its beak on a cactus.
